abstract: Lone Star Funds said it would divest itself of two of its South Korean holdings, fueling speculation it was planning to exit the country.
snippet: Lone Star Funds said it would divest itself of two of its South Korean holdings, fueling speculation it was planning to exit the country.
lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea, April 4 (NYT)  Lone Star Funds, the private equity firm based in Dallas, said on Wednesday that it would divest itself of two of its South Korean holdings  a construction company and a leasing company  fueling speculation it was planning to exit the country.

headline.main: Equity Firm to Sell South Korean Units
headline.print_headline: Equity Firm to Sell South Korean Units
